metadata.title: CVE-2017-7537 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
It was found that a mock CMC authentication plugin with a hardcoded secretwas accidentally enabled by default in the pki-core package before 10.6.4.An attacker could potentially use this flaw to bypass the regularauthentication process and trick the CA server into issuing certificates.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2017-7537` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

dogtag-pki - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
dogtag-pki-console-theme - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
dogtag-pki-server-theme - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
libsymkey-java - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
libsymkey-jni - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-base - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-base-java - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-ca - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-console - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-javadoc - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-kra - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-ocsp - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-server - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-tks - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-tools - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-tps - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
pki-tps-client - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
python3-pki-base - 10.6.0-1ubuntu2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: dogtag-pki package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '10.6.0-1ubuntu2').
